brief_description of the content in the: The source URL provides information about a rule that reports any calls to methods from the junit.framework.Assert, org.junit.Assert, or org.junit.Assume classes inside JUnit 5 tests. It suggests migrating to org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions / org.junit.jupiter.api.Assumptions to avoid dependencies on old JUnit versions.
generated_rule_explanation from GPT-4: The rule 'JUnit5ObsoleteAssertions' checks all classes and their methods. If a method contains calls to 'junit.framework.Assert', 'org.junit.Assert', or 'org.junit.Assume', it asserts that the method does not contain calls to 'org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions' and 'org.junit.jupiter.api.Assumptions'. If the assertion fails, it generates a message suggesting migration to 'org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions' or 'org.junit.jupiter.api.Assumptions'.
PRE_model_validation: The rule is syntactically correct and follows the RSL syntax. It uses the built-in functions 'getClasses', 'getMethods', 'callExists', 'getName', and 'getFQN'. The rule does not introduce any new built-in functions.
3rd-party most relevant URLs and summary:
1. URL: https://www.baeldung.com/junit-5-migration - This page provides a comprehensive guide on migrating from JUnit 4 to JUnit 5, including the replacement of old assertions with the new ones in JUnit 5.
2. URL: https://junit.org/junit5/docs/current/user-guide/#writing-tests-assertions - This is the official JUnit 5 documentation that explains the new assertions and assumptions in JUnit 5.
